code: @Manual{,   title = {margot: Marginal Analysis and Research for General Observational Treatments},   author = {Joseph A Bulbulia},   year = {2024},   website = {https://go-bayes.github.io/margot/}, }

what: This package offers a gentle introduction to R
title: This package offers a gentle introduction to R
text: Marginal Analysis Research General Observational Treatments goal margot improve causal inference, emphasise psychological science. Currently, margot consists synthetic longitudinal dataset used teaching purposes.

title: This package offers a gentle introduction to R
text: can install development version margot like :

title: This package offers a gentle introduction to R
code: library("margot")  # summary of agreeableness responses by wave in retained sample df_nz |>    dplyr::select(id, wave, agreeableness) |>    dplyr::group_by(wave) |>    dplyr::summarise(mean = mean(agreeableness, na.rm = TRUE))

what: Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
title: Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
text: function transforms longitudinal data wide format performs imputation baseline variables. leverages `mice` package imputation, ensuring missing baseline data appropriately handled. function arranges data participant id time, filters based time conditions, reshapes data wide format. Imputed data merged back, maintaining structure suitable analysis.

title: Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
text: .data dataframe containing longitudinal data. baseline_vars character vector baseline variable names include impute necessary. exposure_var character vector specifying names exposure variables. outcome_vars character vector specifying names outcome variables.

title: Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
text: data frame wide format imputed baseline variables.

title: Wide Format Data Transformation with Baseline Imputation — margot_wide_impute_baseline
code: # the df_nz is a dataset available in the 'margot' package data(df_nz, package = "margot")  df_nz <- data.frame(df_nz) wide_data_imputed <- margot_wide_impute_baseline(df_nz,   baseline_vars = c("age", "male", "religion_believe_god"),   exposure_var = ("forgiveness"),   outcome_vars = ("kessler_latent_anxiety")   ) #> Error in .data %>% mutate(time = as.numeric(wave) - 1) %>% arrange(id,     time): could not find function "%>%"

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.
